greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that 2n+1 = 2q + p for some odd prime q, or 0 if no such prime exists.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n < 4 there are no such primes, thus a(1)-a(3)=0.
program: (Scheme) (define (A103506 n) (let ((ind (A103509 n))) (if (zero? ind) 0 (A000040 ind)))) -- _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 19 2007
results.author: _Lei Zhou_, Feb 09 2005
